Legacy Documentation

Access documentation from previous documentation systems

Legacy Documentation #

As part of our Enterprise Documentation System consolidation project, we maintain access to legacy documentation systems during the migration process. This ensures teams can find the information they need while we work to bring all documentation into a consistent format and location.

Legacy Documentation Systems #

Confluence Documentation

Legacy product documentation, APIs, and integration guides previously maintained in Confluence.

Access Confluence Docs

SharePoint Knowledge Base

Internal guidelines, policies, and best practices previously stored in SharePoint.

Access SharePoint Docs

WordPress Knowledge Hub

Public-facing documentation, tutorials, and FAQs previously hosted on WordPress.

Access WordPress Docs

Migration Status #

We are actively migrating content from legacy systems to the Enterprise Documentation System. The migration process includes:

  1. Content Audit: Identifying all existing documentation and assessing its relevance and quality
  2. Format Conversion: Converting content from various formats to Markdown
  3. Structure Alignment: Organizing content according to our new information architecture
  4. Quality Assurance: Reviewing and updating content to meet current standards
  5. Publishing: Moving content to the Enterprise Documentation System

Migration Progress

Confluence Documentation 65%
SharePoint Knowledge Base 42%
WordPress Knowledge Hub 78%

Last updated: February 25, 2025

Accessing Legacy Content #

During the migration period, you can access legacy documentation in two ways:

  1. Through the links above: These links will take you to the legacy systems with their original interfaces.
  2. Through the search function: Our search includes results from legacy systems, labeled with their source.

Reporting Issues #

If you encounter any issues with legacy documentation or have questions about the migration process, please contact the Documentation Team at docs@example.com.
